metadata.title: CVE-2019-18282 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The flow_dissector feature in the Linux kernel 4.3 through 5.x before5.3.10 has a device tracking vulnerability, aka CID-55667441c84f. Thisoccurs because the auto flowlabel of a UDP IPv6 packet relies on a 32-bithashrnd value as a secret, and because jhash (instead of siphash) is used.The hashrnd value remains the same starting from boot time, and can beinferred by an attacker. This affects net/core/flow_dissector.c and relatedcode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18282` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-170-generic - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-lowlatency - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-4.4.0-170-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-170-generic - 4.4.0-170.199
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-170-lowlatency - 4.4.0-170.199
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-74-generic - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-74-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-74-lowlatency - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-74-generic - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-74-lowlatency - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1063-kvm - 4.4.0-1063.70
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1099-aws - 4.4.0-1099.110
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1057-aws - 4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1066-azure - 4.15.0-1066.71
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1052-gcp - 4.15.0-1052.56
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-170.199').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1063.70').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1099.110').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.71').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.56').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.34~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.135').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1130.138').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
